intro: Neurolobium cymosum, commonly known as the clustered neurolobium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, giving it its common name. Neurolobium cymosum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
